channel.title: Machine Learning on Just my blog
channel.description: Recent content in Machine Learning on Just my blog

item.title: Log loss metric explained
item.description: LogLoss is a classification metric based on probabilities. It measures the performance of a classification model where the prediction input is a probability value between 0 and 1. For any given problem, a smaller LogLoss value means better predictions.

item.title: Great Github and Reddit resources for machine learning
item.description: Here are links to 5 Github repositories and 2 Reddit discussions devoted to Machine learning. Actually, this is mostly copy of the original post on Analitcs Vidhya: 5 Amazing Machine Learning GitHub Repositories & Reddit Threads from September 2018. Gihub repos 1. Papers with code Link: https://github.com/zziz/pwc List of research articles (links to original PDFs are given). Each article is accompanied by sorce code of the software, so it should be not hard to understand the implementation of the algorithms.

item.title: Useful ML articles
item.description: I have got a list of useful ML articles from ODS slack (message link).

item.title: Pandas dataset analysis example
item.description: Let’s show how can we use Pandas for data analysis. Let’s take a cardio dataset from here: https://github.com/iryndin/Machine-Learning/tree/master/data/01-cardio

item.title: How to standout as an entry level data scientist candidate
item.description: Today I found a nice post in LinkedIn: How to Stand Out as an Entry-Level Data Scientist Candidate. I liked it very much, and I think it contains pretty much true points. Here they are.
